name: Ottawa JavaScript
description: Ottawa JavaScript is a friendly and fast-growing community of local developers exploring new, innovative technologies related to JavaScript. We cover everything from node, noSQL, HTML5, mobile apps, big data, and hardware hacking... to flying robots! Our monthly meetups feature interesting talks and demos by members at all levels.

name: tim.js
description:
this is a group for anyone working with or interested in the technologies around javascript: end-to-end javascript development, node.js, phonegap, jquery, backbone, mongodb, mvc and others.

Atwood's Law: any application that can be written in JavaScript, will eventually be written in JavaScript.

next_event.name: tim.js meetup 36: How do you "type" JavaScript?

name: Portland JavaScript Admirers
description:
We host monthly presentations and discussions on everything JavaScript-related - including client-side application frameworks, node.js, CoffeeScript, and whatever else comes up.

Join the conversation by subscribing to our mailing list on Google Groups.

Follow the Portland JavaScript Admirers on Twitter or on Google+.

Find out about other groups and events in Portland on Calagator.

name: NodeSchool Amsterdam
description: NodeSchool is a set of do-it-yourself open source workshops created by the community, for the community. After installing you can step through the lessons for each topic at your own pace, learning how to use node.js, npm and other related tools by writing code to solve realistic problems. You can take the lessons yourself online if you're interested – NodeSchool events are a great incentive to work through the workshops with fellow local developers, sharing advice if you're ever stuck or are curious about alternative solutions.

organizer.name: JP Wesselink
organizer.bio: NodeSchool Organizer, enfant terrible, metal head.

name: Microsoft Girişimcilik Buluşmaları
description: Hangi platformda (.NET, Java, PHP, Node.JS, Python, Ruby vs.) hangi işletim sisteminde (Windows, Linux vs.) olursa olsun, yazılım geliştiren, teknoloji odaklı girişimcilerin bir araya gelerek tecrübelerini paylaştığı, yeni teknolojiler ve girişimcilik dünyasını ilgilendiren herşeyi konuştuğu "Microsoft Girişimci Buluşmaları" meetup'ımıza sizi de bekliyoruz.

name: Free Code Camp Portland
description: Hi Campers. Free Code Camp is a 100% free online curriculum teaching technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, ReactJS, node.js, and mongodb. Students or "campers" complete challenges and projects towards certificates and then are eligible to work on actual development projects for non-profits. This group is for campers looking to get together and share their current projects, work on any challenges, and socialize and collaborate with other campers and mentors. Bring your laptop and come learn some JavaScript!

name: Utrecht JavaScript Meetup
description: This is a group for all things JavaScript in Utrecht (city and Province, that means you Amersfoort, Veenendaal). We are not quite sure how many people would show up for this. So we'll do a mixed JavaScript thing. Think MVC (e.g. AngularJS, Ember, BladerunnerJS etc) but also Node.js (e.g. server side JS, REST, ElasticSearch integration etc), but even GameDevs who dabble with JavaScript or Data Scientists/people/journalists who do D3.js or Leaflet.

name: Unity Helsinki Events
description:
Join our glorious Open House events, meetups and other gatherings! 

Unity is the best game development ecosystem in the world. In our office in Helsinki the teams mainly focus on the development of Unity Ads and Project X. We have a wide-variety of technologies we work with: our web stack is mainly JavaScript from the frontend based on Angular or React to a Go and node.js-powered backend connected to a MongoDB and Cassandra. Then there's always the mobile technologies where work with Java and Objective-C, creating OpenGL voodoo. Our products have a long term vision, truly global reach and already a huge user base. All of this in a company that is not a start-up anymore, has a healthy revenue stream, but has not lost a good start-up spirit. 

Step inside our studios:

www.unity3d.com

www.unity3d.com/helsinki

www.instagram.com/unityfinland

www.facebook.com/unityfinland

name: YLD University
description:
Let's get together for informal training sessions provided by YLD. We are going to explore a lot of different topics, from React to Node.JS and fun activities with the team!

Code of Conduct

• http://confcodeofconduct.com

name: Web App Front End Development & Design Best Practices
description:
Web App Front End Development & Design Best Practices is for developers that have moved beyond fundamentals of HTML, CSS, JavaScript and "mobile first" development. As a tech lead or architect you should know of preprocessors, such as Sass, SPA, Pug and Node.js, and maybe a bit about web components and data binding. There are plenty of communities for newbies, but this community is for more advanced people with at least a few years of professional experience and already have a github, portfolio or a website.

Some of the things we talk about great looking web apps such as: http://masons-foundation.org/post/asites/ <br>And/or best practices. And or discuss each other’s portfolios or CodePen.io.

We are trying to form a community of contributors. You can reach other members here: <br> http://gitter.im/topseed-demos/Lobby <br>And there are some examples here http://github.com/topseed/topseed-demos

Also, if you would like to present on a related topic, please do. Or if you have ideas for larger or better venues, please contact the organizers.

name: Learn to Code Austin
description:
Have you ever thought about learning to code but weren't sure how to get started? Come meet other aspirational coders and explore the fundamentals of programming and develop an attitude that will enable us to quickly learn new technologies. 

Each Meetup will be led by an expert who will guide us in a new skill or concept, and help us get started with programming, 

Here are some example of topics we will cover:  

• Intro to HTML and CSS

• Intro to Javascript

• Intro to Git and GitHub 

• Intro to jQuery, Angular, Node.js, Express.js, Meteor, Ruby on Rails, and more!

We will also host workshops, panels, and speaking events for more intermediate and advanced coders. All levels are welcome to attend, whether you're interested in a career or pursuing code as a hobby. 

This Meetup is sponsored by Galvanize, which offers a 6-month course in full stack web development. These events serve as primers for prospective students, and much of the topics are guided by the course's curriculum design. For all inquiries, including food and drink or other sponsorship, please reach out to Lee Ngo at lee.ngo@galvanize.com.

organizer.name: Jared Polivka
organizer.bio: Startups, storytelling and fitness; these are a few of my favorite things.

name: JavaScript and the Internet of Things Meetup
description:
Want to talk about Node.js on the Raspberry Pi or Tessel 2? How about JavaScript MicroControllers like the Espruino?

All meetup attendies, sponsors and speakers agree to abide by the code of conduct.

next_event.name: "thingSoC": Simple Hardware Sockets for the Internet of Things

name: Google Developer Group: GDG North Jersey
description:
Google Developer Group: GDG North Jersey welcomes members from all walks of life and skill levels from beginners to seasoned veterans to learn about and develop cool stuff from the Google family of technologies as well as other modern tech.  We also occasionally feature less techie events dedicated to startup culture, Women Techmakers, the Jersey Startup scene and others.  Variety is the spice of life. 

Some of the tech topics that we cover include gems from Google's lineup including the likes of: AngularJS, Google Cloud Platform (Compute Engine, App Engine), Google+, Google Drive, Node.js (based on Chrome's V8 engine), Android, Google Glass, Dart, Go, Google Maps API, Web Search, Google Cast, Java and Python just to name a few. 

We're a very interactive group with regular events such as tech talks, codelabs (hands-on coding sessions), all-day devfests, hackathons, tech trivia events, collaborative events with other local groups and many other special events. 

Stop procrastinating, press Join, and come code with us!  

Make sure to follow us on Twitter (@gdgnorthjersey) and Periscope (@gdgnorthjersey) 

Disclaimer: GDG North Jersey is an independent group; our activities and the opinions expressed here should in no way be linked to Google, the corporation.

name: Web Dev Office Hours
description:
Do you want to learn how to code but aren't sure how to get started? This group can help you do just that. The purpose of this group is to form a community where we help and push each other explore different areas in web development and share anything we might have learned. We will meet twice a month at Rustic Couch in Duluth and even though there is no "agenda", the meetings will be lead by Eugen and myself (Paul) who will have stuff ready to share such as a new concept, tool, language, etc. 

Topics might include:

• HTML/CSS/JS

• Design Patterns

• AngularJS

• JQuery 

• Bootstrap

• Node

• TypeScript

• Tooling 

Official Github repo: https://github.com/webdev-office-hours

name: Communauté JavaScript and Co. Toulouse
description:
JS (Java Script) est un langage qui grâce à ses nombreux frameworks et librairies permet en 2016 de répondre à presque toutes les problématiques du Web et du développement en général.
Parmi les plus célèbres techs associées à JS nous citerons : Mongo D, Socket, Node etc…
Tu es le bienvenu si :
-Tu es un Dev JS
-Tu as des questions sur le langage ou les technologies associés à JS
- Tu es simplement curieux
- Tu souhaites te former à JS
- Tu es entrepreneur et a besoin de renseignements sur les possibilités de ce langage
- Tu t’appelles Batman, Wonder Woman, Stark mais pas si tu es un homme poisson
-Tu cherches un Taf de dev ou de CTO
- Tu cherches un Associé
… Enfin plus on est de fous plus on rit donc VIENDEZ TOUS

name: Girl Develop It Tampa Bay
description:
Women Developers and Programmers! 

Want to learn how to code? Have a great idea? Don't be shy. Develop it! 

It can be intimidating for women to learn and ask questions when they are in an extreme minority. While open and welcoming, today's budding developer community is up to 91% male. There isn't a comfortable place where women can learn at their own pace and not be afraid to ask "stupid questions." 

We decided it was time to provide a place where all questions are OK and everyone can learn in a supportive environment. Our courses focus on coding, leveraging existing technology, and having something to show for it (aka building sweet websites).

Girl Develop It is a national nonprofit organization dedicated to providingaffordable and accessible technology classes for women in a judgement-free environment. 

Whether you want to advance your own knowledge of technology for your current job, or are looking to transition into a more tech-minded job, we're here to help get you the skills you need!

Courses we offer on a rotating basis:

• Intro to HTML / CSS 

• Intro to Responsive Web Design 

• Intro to HTML5 and CSS3 

• Intro to Javascript 

• Intro to Sass 

• Intro to Web Servers with Node.JS 

• Intro to the Command Line 

• Intro to Git and Github 

FAQ:

"I'm a guy. Can I come?" 
Absolutely! We welcome anybody who wants to learn technology skills, all we ask is that you adhere to our Code of Conduct.

"Do you teach kids? / Can I bring my kids?" 
Our organization is not equipped to teach anybody under the age of 18. As such, we do not offer kids classes. We cannot teach students under the age of 18, even with a guardian present. Check out the Girls Empowerment Network or ChickTech for curriculum for children.

"Why do you charge for your classes?" 
Our instructors are all professionals at the top of their field, and we pay them for their time. Teaching a class, prepping material, slides, and resources is a time-consuming task. For those reasons, we pay our instructors and your class fee ensures our instructors are paid for their time.

"I don't see any upcoming classes" 
That likely means we're taking a quick break between "course tracks." Subscribe to this meetup to be alerted when a new class is added. 

"I have a hackathon / event that your members will really like. Can you help promote it?" 
Unless we have first hand experience with your event and we are able to attest that your event will be friendly towards women or people just getting started in tech, we cannot promote your event.

organizer.name: Girl Develop It
organizer.bio: Girl Develop It is a nonprofit organization that exists to provide affordable and accessible programs to women who want to learn web and software development through mentorship and hands-on instruction.

name: Go Cape Town
description:
Go Cape Town is a meeting place for all interested in golang, irrespective of skill level.

We aim to provide avenues and events for developers to present their ideas and experiences with the go language and to give the growing go community the opportunity to learn, collaborate and just share the things we're currently working on.

Interested in learning more? We welcome all who know a little about Ruby, Node, Python, Perl, Java, PHP or any coding language, really.

Join us.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ytEkHepK08c

name: BucaramangaJS
description:
Hemos creado este grupo con el fin de integrar a la comunidad de desarrolladores Javascript (front end, backend, node, internet of things, nodebots, etc) de la ciudad de Bucaramanga, Colombia, y su área metropolitana. 

Nuestra filosofía será siempre la de mantener un ambiente informal, nada estricto en ningún sentido. Así que cualquier colaboración, en cualquier sentido, será muy bien recibida.

Para participar, inscríbete en nuestro slack: https://bucaramangajs-slack.herokuapp.com/

¡Bienvenido!

organizer.name: José Daniel Paternina
organizer.bio: Desarrollador web con mas de 10 años de experiencia, es líder del equipo de desarrollo en Vulcan Estudios. Ha desarrollado sistemas y aplicaciones para compañías como Pernod Ricard, Aseguratefacil, Viajala, Wikibanco entre otros.

name: Hyperledger San Francisco
description:
Does The Hyperledger Project have the potential to become the engine behind most successful decentralized applications and organizations created in the next 25-50 years? Absolutely!

A much better question is how, and in what new ways, can we:

a) Build decentralized applications, organizations and APIs at 10x the speed at 1/10 the cost.

b) Build situational awareness in the local community.

I believe that the convergence of decentralized applications, decentralized organizations, artificial intelligence and IoT brings upon us the Great Displacement of the 21st century, where the majority of workforce will be left without “conventional” jobs, forced to learn new skills and professions.

Why?

Founders of this group believe that the Hyperledger Foundation will be the engine behind decentralization of the world, a massive economic change of the next 25-50 years.

So.... why don't we standardize and democratize the field with and around Hyperledger?

What?

We are a local micro community of those interested in advancing their knowledge of Hyperledger, its use cases and applications.

How?

Join our group for a regular dose of human interaction, conversations, smiles, food and drinks on all things Hyperledger:

• Use Cases

• Competitive analysis of Hyperledger startups (Distributed Apps from disruptive companies in specific vertical markets)

• How-To’s

• Interviews with individuals working at the edge of the Hyperledger project

• Reviews of tools, services and APIs offered by the Hyperledger ecosystem

• Best Practices in Application Architecture

• Do’s and Don’ts

• Application Templates

• Hackathons

• Security in the decentralized world - on the edge, on the node, in the cloud and in transit

• How others solve some of the hard problems that exist in the world using Hyperledger.

Join the movement. Let’s change the world. Because with Hyperledger we can.

https://github.com/hyperledger

https://github.com/hyperledger

name: Mozilla Developer Roadshow
description:
We’re bringing Mozilla’s Developer Roadshow to a city near you! Join us for a Mozilla-focused event series designed for people who build the Web. Hear from expert speakers highlighting the latest and best from Mozilla,  Firefox, and web standards.

Speakers will cover technologies, standards, tools and research topics for the Open Web, including:

• WebAssembly

• Service Workers

• CSS Grid & Layout

• Electrolysis (e10s)

• Developer Tools, including Grid Inspector and Node Debugger

• Game Development

• Mozilla and Firefox

• Open Source Workshop

• Web Compatibility

• Web Extensions

• Web Security, including Let’s Encrypt and tracking protection

• Web Games

• Web VR

• Quantum, Rust, Servo
